Dear Ms. Canales:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Section prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth’s behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth’s
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff are using improper restraints with youth at the facility. This
includes leaving nail marks on one youth and laying on youth,
making it difficult to breath.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on May 30, 2023,
and reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at school on June 1,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A described
getting into a fight with Youth C and being restrained by Staff 4.
Youth A stated Youth C started coming at her, swinging to punch
her, and saying she was going to beat Youth A’s “ass”. Youth A
reported she started swinging at Youth C and was placed in an
upper torso restraint for about 20 seconds by Staff 4. Youth A
reported she asked to be let go and tried to walk away while in the
restraint. Youth A described swinging her body around, bending
forward and lifting Staff 4 off the ground. Youth A stated Staff 2
came to assist Staff 4 with the restraint and pulled Youth A’s left
arm, causing Youth A’s wrist to hurt. Youth A stated as she was
2

attempting to walk away, while in the restraint, she hit her head on
the door frame and scraped her leg on a box that was sitting in the
hallway. Youth A reported Staff 2 told Staff 4, “put her on her ass
if she doesn’t corporate.” Youth A stated the only other youth
present was Youth C, but she was removed from the situation by
Staff 2. Youth A stated she had concerns with how Staff 2
restrained Youth B. Youth A described Staff 2 laying on her side
but leaning over Youth B’s torso to restrain Youth B. Youth A
stated Youth B was gasping for air and yelling she could not
breathe. Youth A reported Staff 1, Staff 4 and Staff 2 were
watching but none of the staff intervened. Youth A reported Youth
C tried pushing Staff 2 off Youth B. Youth A stated she told Staff
2 to get off Youth B and saw Staff 2 pinching Youth B’s arm.
Youth A stated after about two minutes Staff 2 got off Youth B and
Staff 5 gave Youth B her inhaler. Youth A stated Staff 2 was not
holding Youth B’s arms like staff normally would during a restraint
and was also laying over Youth B’s torso, which Youth A has not
seen before in a restraint.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at school on June 1,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B described
being restrained by Staff 2 for no reason. Youth B stated she was
placed in an upper torso restraint outside by Staff 2 for punching
Youth E. Youth B stated she “jerked her arms free” while in the
restraint outside and entered the house. Youth B reported Staff 2
and Staff 4 stopped Youth B by the stairs when she entered the
house. Youth B stated Staff 4 grabbed both of Youth B’s arms
from behind, Staff 2 grabbed Youth B’s left side/arm and tackled
Youth B to the floor. Youth B stated she was on her back with
Staff 2 sprawled over her and Youth B could not breathe. Youth B
described being on the floor, on her back while Staff 2 laid over
her stomach and pinched her arm. Youth B stated Staff 2 was
holding Youth B’s left wrist while Staff 5 tried to hold Youth B’s
feet. Youth B stated Youth C and Youth D pushed Staff 2 off
Youth B. Youth B stated she could not remember how the
restraint ended but believes she just “stopped fighting.” Youth B
reported after the restraint Staff 4 brought Youth B her inhaler.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 1,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C stated
Youth B and Youth E were punching each other outside. Youth C
stated Staff 2 or Staff 4 grabbed Youth B’s upper arms from the
back and placed Youth B in an upper torso restraint. Youth C
stated Youth B jerked away and ran inside the house. Youth C
described Youth B being “slammed” to the floor by Staff 2 after
coming inside. Youth C reported Staff 2 sat on Youth B’s chest
3

and Youth B yelled seven times she could not breathe while
turning blue. Youth C stated Staff 2 placed her forearm on Youth
B’s chest causing Youth B to not be able to breathe. Youth C
reported Youth D and Youth C tried to push Staff 2 off Youth B.
Youth C stated Youth B started crying, got up, ran to her room and
was given her inhaler by staff. Youth C described getting into a
fight with Youth A and Youth A getting restrained by Staff 4.
Youth C stated this happened right before Youth B’s restraint.
Youth C stated when Youth A was being restrained by Staff 4,
Staff 2 told Staff 4 to “put her on her ass.” Youth C stated she did
not hear Staff 2 say that, but Youth A told her Staff 2 said it.
Youth C reported Staff 2 and Staff 3 have made that statement to
her during a restraint. Youth C reported Staff 2 pinches youth
while she restrains them.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 7,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth D reported
she was not sure why Youth B was placed in a restraint, but it
might have been something that occurred outside between Youth
B and another youth. Youth D stated she saw Staff 2 sitting on
Youth B’s chest so Youth D kept yelling at Staff 2 to get off Youth
B’s chest. Youth D reported Staff 2 did the same thing to her
once, so she thought Staff 2 was doing the same to Youth B.
Youth D reported she got mad and tried to push Staff 2 off Youth
B. Youth D reported she heard Youth B say she could not breathe
but did not hear Staff 2 say anything to Youth B. Youth D denied
ever seeing Staff 2 pinch youth during a restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 7,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 described
placing Youth C in an upper torso restraint due to Youth C going
after Youth A and punching Youth A. Staff 1 stated he placed
Youth C in a restraint and moved Youth C away from the situation
while Staff 4 and Staff 2 worked to de-escalate Youth A. Staff 1
reported he did not see Youth A’s restraint because he was
restraining Youth C. Staff 1 stated he did not see Staff 2 restrain
Youth B in the living room. Staff 1 reported being outside with
multiple youth and Youth B verbally arguing with Youth E. Staff 1
described Youth B yelling at Youth E, grabbing a bucket of water,
and running toward Youth E with the bucket of water. Staff 1
stated he yelled for staff assistance and stepped in-between
Youth B and Youth E. Staff 1 reported Youth B punched Youth E
and at that time Staff 2 arrived for assistance. Staff 1 stated he
entered the house to take Youth E to the sensory room to calm
down while Staff 2 was outside with Youth B. Staff 1 described
entering the house, another youth saying something to him,
4

turning to say something to that youth and then being hit in the
face by Youth B. Staff 1 reported Staff 4 placed Youth B in an
upper torso restraint. Staff 1 reported Staff 5 took Youth E to the
sensory room while Staff 1 walked back outside. Staff 1 stated he
did not see Staff 2 restrain Youth B. Staff 1 denied having any
concerns with staff restraining youth or seeing nail marks on youth
from a restraint. Staff 1 denied seeing any staff member pinch
youth during a restraint.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 7,
and via Teams on June 20, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. Staff 2 described hearing Youth A and Youth C yelling
and swearing back and forth with one another. Staff 2 stated Staff
4 was in-between Youth A and Youth C, trying to get Youth A to
her bedroom away from Youth C. Staff 2 reported Youth C
reached over Staff 4 to try and hit Youth A and Youth A began
pushing Staff 4 to reach Youth C. Staff 2 stated Staff 4 placed
Youth A in an upper torso restraint and kept telling Youth A to
calm down and they would go to Youth A’s bedroom to get away
from Youth C. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 placed Youth C in a restraint
and removed her from the situation. Staff 2 denied touching
Youth A or Youth C but was next to Staff 4 to assist if necessary.
Staff 2 stated Staff 4 was able to walk with Youth A into Youth A’s
bedroom. Staff 2 denied seeing Youth A hit her head or scrape
her leg on anything. Staff 2 reported right after this incident she
heard Staff 1 calling for assistance. Staff 2 reported she went
outside and saw Youth B holding Youth E’s braid and punching
Youth E in the head. Staff 2 stated she approached Youth B, who
let go of Youth E’s braid, and held Youth B’s hands and told Youth
B to calm down. Staff 2 described having a good relationship with
Youth B and being one of the staff to be able to calm Youth B
down when Youth B is escalated. Staff 2 stated Youth B then hit
Staff 2 and pulled Staff 2’s hair. Staff 2 reported another youth
saw this and came over and hit Youth B. Staff 2 stated she turned
her body to focus on the other youth and Youth B entered the
house. Staff 2 described entering the house and seeing Youth B
in an upper torso restraint by Staff 4. Staff 2 reported Youth B
was flaring her body, moving back and forth and it appeared Staff
4 was struggling to maintain her hold. Staff 2 stated she told Staff
4 she was going to assist, and they would do a hook transport to
move Youth B out of the entryway of the house into the living
room. Staff 2 stated she was able to get one of Youth B’s arms
when suddenly Staff 2 was shoved from the back by someone and
fell to the ground. Staff 2 stated she saw Youth C pushing and
punching Staff 4 at the same time. Staff 2 stated Staff 4, Youth B
and herself fell to the ground and Youth D started punching Staff
5

2. Staff 2 described Staff 4 let go of Youth B’s arm and got
between Youth D and Staff 2. Staff 2 reported Youth D was
yelling that Youth B could not breathe. Staff 2 stated she sat to
the side of Youth B, who was laying on her back kicking and
punching Staff 2 with her free hand, while Staff 2 held Youth B’s
other arm to the ground. Staff 2 reported Staff 5 assisted briefly
with Youth B’s legs. Staff 2 reported being able to get Youth B’s
arm across Staff 2’s lap while Staff 5 moved up to do the same on
Youth B’s other side. Staff 2 stated she kept adjusting herself but
at no time was she laying across Youth B. Staff 2 stated Youth B
stopped struggling and Staff 2 and Staff 5 helped Youth B sit up.
Staff 2 reported Youth B was yelling and fighting the restraint the
entire time. Staff 2 denied ever pinching or leaving nail marks on
any youth during a restraint. Staff 2 denied seeing any staff
member pinch or leave nail marks on a youth during a restraint.
Staff 2 showed her hands to DHHS Worker and me, and pointed
out she does not have long nails to be able to leave any nail
marks.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 7,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 denied
seeing any staff member pinch or dig their nails into a youth
during a restraint. Staff 3 denied pinching any youth during a
restraint.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 7,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth E reported
being outside, asking staff for a phone call and Youth B yelling at
her. Youth E stated Youth B grabbed a bucket of water and threw
the water at Youth E. Youth E reported she tried to go after Youth
B, but staff stepped between them. Youth E described coming
into the house with staff and going to the sensory room. Youth E
denied seeing Youth B being placed in a restraint but was told by
other youth a staff member sat on Youth B’s chest.
Staff 4 was interviewed via Teams on June 20, 2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 described restraining
Youth A because Youth A and Youth C were hitting one another.
Staff 4 stated Staff 1 placed Youth C in a restraint and removed
Youth C from the situation while Staff 4 had Youth A in a restraint.
Staff 4 described Staff 2 coming to assist, but not being involved
in either restraint. Staff 4 denied Youth A hitting her head or
scratching her leg during the restraint. Staff 4 reported right after
this incident she heard screaming coming from the living room.
Staff 4 stated she entered the living room and saw Youth B hitting
Staff 1 in the face so Staff 4 placed Youth B in an upper torso
6

restraint. Staff 4 reported Staff 2 came to assist, and they were
going to transition to a two-person restraint of Youth B but were
pushed from behind by Youth C. Staff 4 stated Youth D went after
Staff 2 so Staff 4 let go of Youth B’s arm to get Youth D away from
Staff 2. Staff 4 reported she heard Youth B screaming saying,
“get off me, I can’t breathe.” Staff 4 described Youth B hitting
Staff 2, kicking her legs and being very escalated. Staff 4 stated
she saw Staff 2 sitting by Youth B’s side, scooting away, and
adjusting her hold on Youth B. Staff 4 denied seeing Staff 2 sit or
lay across Youth B’s chest at any time during the restraint. Staff 4
denied seeing any staff pinch or dig their nails into a youth during
a restraint. Staff 4 denied hearing any youth mention these
concerns. Staff 4 stated she does not have any concerns with the
restraints staff members are involved in and feels the restraints
are only done when warranted.
Staff 5 was interviewed via Teams on June 20, 2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 5 described being
upstairs when she heard commotion in the living room. Staff 5
reported she came downstairs and saw Youth B laying on her
back hitting Staff 2, who was sitting next to Youth B holding one of
Youth B’s arms. Staff 5 stated she sat next to the side of Youth B
and held Youth B’s arm. Staff 5 stated Youth B then sat up and
was released from the restraint. Staff 5 denied seeing Staff 2 sit
or lay across Youth B. Staff 5 stated she heard Youth B say one
time she could not breathe. Staff 5 denied seeing any staff pinch
or dig their nails into a youth during a restraint. Staff 5 reported
not having any concerns with restraints she has been in or
witnessed by other staff members.
DHHS Worker has no findings in the investigation.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of the two restraints on May 28, 2023, were
reviewed at the facility on June 1, 2023.
Video shows Staff 4 in-between Youth A and Youth C. Youth C is
seen reaching over to hit Youth A and Youth A turning to hit Youth
C. Staff 4 places Youth A in an upper torso restraint while Staff 2
is seen walking into the hallway to assist. Youth C is no longer in
camera view, so the restraint is not visible. Staff 2 places an open
hand on Youth A’s upper arm while Staff 4 maintains Youth A in
an upper torso restraint. Staff 2 and Youth A walk down the
hallway and out of camera view. The video does not show Youth
A hit her head or scratch her leg. Video does not show Staff 2
pinching Youth A’s upper arm.
7

Video shows Youth B enter the home, punch Staff 1 in the head
and be restrained by Staff 4. Staff 2 walks in from outside and
moves to assist Staff 4 by taking Youth B’s left arm. Youth C
pushes Staff 4 from behind and Staff 2, Staff 4 and Youth B fall to
the ground. Youth B lands on her back, Youth C kicks Staff 4
while on the ground and Youth D begins to punch and push Staff
2, all while on the ground. Staff 4 let’s go of Youth B and restrains
Youth D. Youth B is viewed kicking, flaring one arm, and
punching Staff 2 with her free hand. Staff 2 is viewed holding
Youth B’s left arm to the ground and reaching over Youth B’s torso
to attempt to get Youth B’s right arm that is punching Staff 2. Staff
2 is viewed sitting next to Youth B, not on top of Youth B. Staff 2
is holding Youth B’s left arm with her right hand and Youth B’s
right hand with Staff 2’s left hand. This is an approved Safe Crisis
Management (SCM) single person supine torso assist.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
related to restraints and Staff 2 completed the required
SCM training on 2/4/23.
• Staff 4’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
Staff 4 completed the required SCM training on 10/26/22.
• Youth Opportunity Investment Incident Reports dated
5/29/2023 describing the restraints of Youth A and Youth B
which occurred on 5/28/2023. The incident reports were
consistent with staff interviews and video footage reviewed.
• MiSACWIS incident restraint report 155570210 and
155590204 which were consistent with staff interviews and
video footage reviewed.
• SCM manual showing single person supine torso assist as
one of the approved techniques to be used by staff.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as staff interviews and review of
video footage of both restraints does not show improper restraints
being performed by staff members. Video footage does not show
staff members pinching or digging their nails into youth during
restraints.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
8

(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff are speaking inappropriately to youth.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed face to face at school on June 1,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported
during med pass Staff 2 said she “was gonna beat all the kids’
asses.” Youth A stated Staff 2 and Staff 3 tell the youth they are
“worthless.”
Youth B was interviewed face to face at school on June 1,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B stated after
going AWOL and being brought back by the police Staff 3, Staff 4
and Staff 5 told Youth A she was “stupid and gonna get locked up
for running away.” Youth B reported the staff also said that to
Youth A after going AWOL. Youth B stated during medication
pass Staff 2 said she was going to beat Youth B’s “ass.” Youth B
reported she told Staff 2 she wanted a different staff to pass
medications and threw Kool-Aid on Staff 2. Youth B then clarified,
Staff 2 was telling Staff 4 she was going to beat Youth B’s “ass”
and Staff 4 told Staff 2, “there’s a kid right there that can hear
you.”
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 1,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C denied
hearing any staff threaten youth during medication pass or any
other time. Youth C described medication pass as one staff and
one youth being back in the medication room at one time. Youth C
reported the morning staff “talk trash about us.” Youth C stated
staff laugh at youth, cuss, and post up on kids. Youth C described
posting up as staff standing with their hands up like they are going
to fight the youth. Youth C reported Staff 2 talks to youth in a
mean way and will say, “at least I get to go home and sleep in my
bed.”
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 7,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth D stated she
heard Staff 2 tell Staff 4 during medication pass she was “gonna
beat her (Youth B) fucking ass.” Youth D reported right after Staff
2 said that Staff 4 told Staff 2, “Youth D is standing right here” and
closed the medication room door. Youth D described this
happening right after Youth B poured Kool-Aid on Staff 2. Youth
9

D reported she has heard Staff 2, Staff 3 and Staff 4 say to staff
when they are restraining youth, “just put them on their ass.”
Youth D reported Staff 3 antagonizes her and other youth by
saying, “do it, see what happens or where that will get you.”
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 7,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 denied ever
hearing any staff member tell another staff member to put a youth
on their “ass” during a restraint, tell youth they are worthless or
say, “this is why you are in foster care.” Staff 1 described Staff 3
as being very strict, holding the youth accountable and always
going by the rules. Staff 1 stated staff members point out to youth
frequently how their actions will have consequences, but it is not
done in a mean, negative way.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 7,
and via Teams on June 20, 2023, in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. Staff 2 described Youth B refusing to take medications
from Staff 2 and throwing Kool-Aid in Staff 2’s face. Staff 2
reported she said to Staff 4, “I’m so pissed right now” then closed
the door to the medication room. Staff 4 denied ever saying she
was going to beat anyone’s “ass”. Staff 2 denied ever telling a
staff member to put a youth “on their ass” during a restraint or
ever hearing a staff member say that to another staff. Staff 2
stated she has not heard staff tell youth they are “worthless” or
say, “at least I get to go home to my own bed tonight.” Staff 2
reported the youth say that to staff “all the time.”
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 7,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported he
has heard staff provide re-direction to youth by saying, “this is
your choice, your house and your actions are not helpful to
anyone.” Staff 3 stated he has heard staff talk to one another
about being frustrated but there have never been kids around
when he hears staff talking. Staff 3 denied ever hearing staff say
they were going to “beat their (youths’) asses,” or staff tell another
staff during a restraint to, “put them (youths’) on their ass.” Staff 3
stated he has talked with the youth about how things are different
in the “real world,” meaning the youths’ actions in the house will
not be tolerated in the real world.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 7,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth E reported
she has heard staff say, “get the fuck in the house” when talking
with youth. Youth E denied ever hearing staff tell youth they are
10

“worthless” or “we get to go home to our own beds tonight.” Youth
E stated “most” of the staff are fair and professional.
Staff 4 was interviewed via Teams on June 20, 2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 described Youth B
refusing to take medications from Staff 2 and throwing Kool-Aid on
Staff 2. Staff 4 stated Staff 2 said, “I can’t be here anymore, this is
a lot” and Youth D may have overheard Staff 2. Staff 4 denied
hearing Staff 2 say she was going to “beat her (Youth B) ass.”
Staff 4 reported staff will say, “that was a lot” after a restraint or an
incident but never swearing at youth. Staff 4 denied ever hearing
a staff member tell a youth they are “worthless” or tell staff while in
a restraint to “put them (youths’) on their ass” or say, “at least I get
to go home at night.”
Staff 5 was interviewed via Teams on June 20, 2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 5 described Youth B
refusing to take medications from Staff 2 and dumping Kool-Aid on
Staff 2. Staff 5 stated after that happened, she heard Staff 2 say
she was tired of the same old stuff happening. Staff 5 denied
hearing staff tell youth they are “worthless” or tell staff while in a
restraint to “put them (youths’) on their ass.” Staff 5 stated it is
common for staff to make comments to one another, but the
comments are never about the youth. Staff 5 reported staff may
say, “we are repeating this cycle” or “doing this every day.” Staff 5
denied having any concerns with staff members’ behaviors.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as it cannot be determined
based on interviews if staff are making inappropriate comments to
youth at the facility. Staff interviews and Youth E do not report
any staff member making inappropriate comments to youth
however Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and Youth D reported staff do
make inappropriate comments.
CONSULTATION:
It was recommended the facility review professional boundaries
with staff and to recognize staff need to vent but in a place away
from youth at an appropriate time.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
11

rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was asked by staff to stay in her room due to other youths
planning to jump her resulting in youth missing 4 days of school.
Staff are now telling youth that she must come downstairs to
participate but the other youths are waiting outside her door.
Youth has not eaten since yesterday, unable to use the bathroom
or call her caseworker. There is no safety plan and youth does not
feel safe.
Investigation Youth B was interviewed face to face at school on June 1,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B denied
being afraid of anyone at the facility. Youth B stated there are
staff she does not respect and will not listen to but does not have
any concerns with staff.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 1,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth C reported
she does not like it at the facility and some of the staff are mean.
Youth C stated, “we do stuff to make staff look dumb because
they can’t do nothing.” Youth C reported staff will separate youth
and not allow them to fight but cannot restrain youth for “no
reason.”
Youth D was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 7,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth D reported
not feeling safe at the facility because there are youth at the
facility who want to beat her up (This is being investigated in
SI2023C0000524). Youth D reported she has not eaten, she
cannot leave her bedroom, cannot use the phone to call her
caseworker and staff are not doing anything to keep her safe.
Youth D was asked to clarify these statements. Youth D stated
three separate times, it was her choice to stay in her bedroom.
Youth D went on to say staff have been bringing food to her
bedroom but told Youth D if she does not come downstairs, she
will lose points because she is not participating in programing.
Youth D reported staff verbally redirect youth when they make
verbal threats or move them to a different room in the house.
When questioned more Youth D stated staff step in if a youth
physically goes after another youth but stated there are girls in the
program who should not be at the house. Youth D said she spoke
with her caseworker the previous day and was going to talk with
her later this afternoon. Youth D stated we (DHHS Worker and I)
12

were not listening or concerned about her and stated she was
done talking and walked out of the room.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 7,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Director reported
Youth D was refusing to come out of her bedroom, so food had
been brought up to her. Director stated Youth D had spoken with
her caseworker and was being encouraged to interact with the
group. Director reported the youth that Youth D says she feels
threatened by are moved to different rooms and kept separate, so
they do not interact. Director reported Youth D refused to go to
school and the facility contacted Youth D’s foster care worker.
Youth E was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 7,
2023, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth E reported
there is a girl at the facility that wants to fight Youth E, but Youth E
